results.title: A Story of women = Une Affaire de femmes
results.creator_credit: MK2 Productions, Marin Karmitz and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description:
‘Une Affaire de Femmes’ has been hailed as one of Chabrol’s finest films. Based on the true story of Marie-Louise Giraud, a wartime mother and abortionist. Since the age of fourteen, Marie has been married to Paul, and has been a devoted and dedicated wife. When Paul returns from the war, he finds that life has changed. Marie-Louise has kept the home and family together and has plenty of money from her illegal business. She decides she no longer needs or wants Paul. The film exposes hypocrisy in its political and personal manifestations. Isabelle Huppert and Francois Cluzet star in this film which won an award for Huppert at the Venice Film festival and which was voted best film at the Melbourne International Film Festival in 1989.
Cast also includes: Marie Trintignant, Nils Tavernier

results.title: A Story of sirex noctilio
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Ted Davis
results.brief_description: The wood-boring wasp sirex noctilio lays its eggs in pine sapwood and infects the tree with a destructive fungus. The pest is established in Tasmania and has been found in Victoria since 1961. Control measures are shown, such as quarantine, burning infected trees and inspection. Research is in progress on the possibility of breeding resistant strains of trees, and on biological control by imported predatory wasps.

results.title: A Story of silver
results.brief_description: Shows the place that silver has held in the past, by reference to documents and art works. Presents craftsmen of earlier times making silverware for use by churches and for the homes of great men. Demonstrates the part played by Georg Jensen, silversmithy, in the development of simpler designs more familiar today as the complex detail is omitted and the line becomes all important.

results.brief_description: Describes the contribution of Darwin, Boysen-Jensen, Paal and Went in establishing the processes which cause plants to react and bend towards the light.

results.title: A story of boys and girls = Storia di ragazzi e di ragazze
results.creator_credit: Duea Film, RAIUNO, Antonio Avati and Pupi Avati
results.brief_description: Angelo, who is from a rich family in Bologna, is engaged to the very beautiful Silvia who is the daughter of peasants in the Italian countryside. To celebrate the engagement, Angelo and Silvia’s families are to come together for a grand lunch at the home of her parents. As the wine flows and the sumptious meal is consumed, family secrets and resentments come to the surface and threaten the young couple’s happiness. Set in the thirties, the rigid codes which govern peasant life are already beginning to become undone: Mussolini is beginning his ascendancy; the dictates of family honour and fidelity are being defied; the centuries old division between poor and the rich is being questioned. But for Angelo and Silvia, caught up in the passion of their love, everything else is secondary. Charming, comic and beautifully filmed “A Story of Boys and Girls” is a rewarding film about the ties of love, family and honour; a film about the last moment in a young nation’s life where it knew peace before the advent of a World War which would tear it apart.

results.title: A story about nan & pop
results.brief_description: Corey Kelly pays tribute to his nan and pop, who have had hard lives but have taught him the meaning of family. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and the Koorie Heritage Trust Inc.

results.title: A Stone in the bush
results.creator_credit: Zzoommovies, Michael Glasheen, Martyn Sanderson and John Allen
results.brief_description: An experimental film giving an impression of the making of the feature film “Ned Kelly” on location near Bungendore, New South Wales, in 1969. Shows the director and stars (including Mick Jagger) working in various locations, accompanied only by the music of the Rolling Stones.

results.title: A Stitch in time
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Hugh Stewart and Robert Asher
results.brief_description: Norman Wisdom was famed for his ability to combine pathos and slapstick. In this motion picture he is an assistant to local butcher Mr. Grimsdale. During a hold up, Norman persuades Mr. Grimsdale to hide his gold watch in his mouth. This foolproof strategy comes unstuck when the watch is swallowed and Grimsdale has to be taken to hospital. Once there Norman is able to wreak havoc and chaos amongst patients and staff alike, but eventually his lovable charm wins the day and he manages to come out on top. Also stars Edward Chapman, Jerry Desmond and Lucy Appleby.
